const newURL = window.location.href;
document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].innerHTML += `<link rel="canonical" href="${newURL}">`
}
</script>

articles.name: Stream functionality options explained
articles.title: Stream functionality options explained
articles.body:
Uberflip Streams have a number of options that help control functionality and appearance. Depending on the type of Stream, you have access to a few different options. This article outlines these options and how to turn them on or off. 

Turn Stream options on or off 

  1. Navigate to the Hub the Stream is in
  2. In the sidebar menu, click Content 
  3. On the Streams tab, find the Stream or DSR you want to manage and click on it
  4. Click the Options tab
  5. Toggle options (outlined below) on or off as desired

Note

Turning options on or off does so at the Stream level only.

Stream options explained

Option: 
(Alphabetical)

 What it does:

Available for Stream types: 
Allow Inline Formatting Allows style and font tags as well as tag style attributes to be imported with this Stream Blogs
Auto redirect to Item's Canonical URL When enabled, Items in this Stream will 301 redirect to their respective original location (if one exists)
All
Automatically create and apply tags from RSS to items When enabled, any categories in the RSS will be created as tags and applied to items Blogs
Disable auto playback Enable this option if you wish to avoid auto playback when the video loads
Video, Docs, DSR, Marketing
Disable Video CTAs If you have Slide-out CTAs in your Vidyard Players, we recommend this option to ensure videos size properly. Consider using Hub CTAs instead Marketing
Display Flipbooks with HTML5 When enabled, Flipbooks opened from this stream will be displayed using HTML5 instead of Flash Docs, DSR, Marketing 
Enable Author Matching Automatically match blog author with existing profiles Blogs
Enable Canonical Meta Tag Add a meta tag to tell search engines to only index this item in its original Stream
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing, Social
Enable Preview Mode When enabled, the Items in this Stream will be shortened and displayed with a 'Continue Reading' button
All
Exclude from overall search results When enabled, all Items within the Stream will be excluded from the search results
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing
Exclude this Stream from the 'Latest Content' feed on your Hub The Items in this Stream will not appear in 'Latest Content' or RSS feeds
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing, Social
Fake Links in Social Tiles When enabled, any links within your social tiles will NOT be clickable, forcing users to view the Item first DSR, Marketing, Social
Feature Items within the Stream When enabled, all featured stream items will be honored (pushed to the top and decorated) in a stream view
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing
For Blog Articles, show 'read more' link to original source When enabled, a 'read more' link displays at the bottom of the Article being read Blogs, DSR, Marketing 
Force Self-Canonical URL When enabled, all items within this stream will have a canonical meta tag that points at it's current location, ignoring the value set in the SEO tab
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing, Social
Hide Publish Date When enabled the publish date will be hidden on all items in this stream
All
List View Display Items in this Stream as a List instead of Tiles. When enabled, share buttons and Stream level CTAs will not display
All
No Robots Meta Tag Prevent search engines from indexing this Stream. If the Hub option of the same name is enabled, it will take precedence over your setting here
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing, Social
Open Flipbooks in 'Expanded' Mode When enabled, Flipbooks opened from this stream will automatically fill the browser window Docs, DSR, Marketing
Pause automatic updating of this Stream When enabled, new content at the source will not automatically import into this Stream. Manually updating the Stream will still be available
Video, Blogs, Social 
Pin in Extensions When checked, the Stream will be pinned as a tab in the Uberflip Chrome and Outlook extensions
Video, Docs, Blogs, Marketing, Social
Prevent using small images as thumbnails If enabled, only images of minimum size 180x100 will display in the tiles for this Stream Blogs
Share Item's Original Location Concerned about split share counts? When enabled, Items displaying in a Marketing Stream will have all share links reference the Item's original Stream Marketing
Show buttons to Download PDF and Expand Flipbook When enabled, 2 large buttons will display underneath a non-expanded Flipbook.
Note that this option will override the Flipbook's Folder settings		 Docs, DSR, Marketing
Show in Extensions When enabled, the Stream will be shown in the Uberflip Chrome and Outlook extensions, and users will able to generate tiles linking to the Stream's Items All

articles.name: Internal: Is It Possible To Make The Author Of An Item Not Clickable?
articles.title: Internal: Is It Possible To Make The Author Of An Item Not Clickable?
articles.body:
Question

Can I make the author of an item not clickable? I want the author name to appear but I do not want it to lead to the authors profile/bio page. Reasons for this could include incomplete author profile/bio page or not wanting visitors directed to a page that has access to other content.

 

Answer

Yes, using a snippet of Javascript custom code we can make the authors name not clickable. You will need to create a Custom Code Block in the hub, select the custom code placement as 'Body Bottom' and add the following Javascript code to the Custom Code Block. You will need to change the URL that appears in the below snippet to the appropriate URL for the authors profile/bio page that you want to make not clickable. (This code is for TV2 hubs, body ID for TV1 hub would need to be adjusted accordingly).

<script>
$("body#uf-item-page a[href$='https://resources.hudl.com/authors/test-author']").contents().unwrap();
</script>

articles.name: Make a feature request
articles.title: Make a feature request
articles.body:
Got an idea that could improve Uberflip? Head to the Uberflip feedback portal and let us know! This article will show you how. 

 

Before you begin

  • Before submitting a feature request or feedback, search the feedback portal to see if it’s already been submitted. Upvoting an existing idea helps us get a better look at how popular it is. 
  • After submitting or upvoting an idea, you can check the status that idea in the Feedback portal at any time.
  • Making a feature request doesn't guarantee your idea will be built. Check out the Will my request be built? section for more details.

 

What is a feature request?  

Feature requests are a way for Uberflip users to suggest new capabilities they think all Uberflip users would love! 

Requests for a specific feature or functionality are one of the many ways that product designers look for areas of improvement in a product. We use feature requests to scope out what users are struggling to do, and build features that help them overcome that. 

Want to chat with the Uberflip Product team?

If you've got a killer idea that you think requires a deeper conversation, the Product team at Uberflip is happy to hear you out! We love chatting with our users to understand your wants and needs. Reach out to your Uberflip CSM, and they can set up a time to chat with a Product team member.   

 

Will my request be built?

Maybe! But also maybe not. This depends on a few things, such as:

  • How many users would this help?
  • How impactful would the feature be to the user experience?
  • Is it doable?
  • Is there a current workaround?
  • And much more

We must prioritize the most impactful features on our product roadmap, which already includes the new stuff the Product team is cooking up. Unfortunately, we can't build features for one account that won't be useful to others. 

In some cases we can't build what you're hoping for, and in some cases we can. But in many cases we look at the problem that’s been noted and think through different ways we can help users overcome that. Then, we'll see if and where a solution could fit into our current roadmap.

 

Submit a feature request: 

Step 1 - Access the Uberflip Feedback Portal

  1. In Uberflip, click the question mark icon in the bottom right corner

  2. Click Submit an idea >  Open in Portal

 

Step 2 - Search existing ideas

  1. Search for your idea using the search field in the top right of the feedback portal
  2. If you find that the idea has been submitted, click the thumbs-up icon to upvote it

Didn’t find your idea listed? Submit it using step 3. 

 

Step 3 - Submit your idea/feedback

  1. In the Feedback Portal, click Dashboard
  2. Click Make a Suggestion
  3. Fill out the request form, including: 
    • The feature request (or struggle you’re looking to overcome)
    • What you’re trying to achieve
    • Your current workaround (if you have one)
    • Supporting files (if you have any)
  4. Click Submit request

That’s it! Our team will review your idea/feedback. You can check on the status of your idea at anytime in the Feedback portal. 

Tip

Change your notifications preferences from the profile settings in the Feedback Portal (Profile Icon > Email Settings).

 

Feature request statuses explained

Feature requests for Uberflip can be in only 1 of 6 statuses at any given time. This section outlines exactly what each status means, so you can be fully informed about where your request is currently. 

New request 
This is a request that hasn’t been reviewed by the Uberflip Product team yet, so no decisions have been made. 

Maybe later
This is a request that we think may be a good idea, but it doesn’t fit within our current roadmap. We’ll keep it in our back pocket and revisit it in the future, but we won’t be moving forward with it at this time. 

Looking into it
This is a request that we are currently investigating. We’re looking at the scope, impact, feasibility, and more to determine if it can or should be added to our roadmap. From here, a request may move forward, but it may also be declined or moved into a “Maybe later” status depending on how our investigation goes.

In progress
A request in this status is currently being built and will likely be released. While this is a very good sign, some projects run into expected road blocks when being built, so there’s still a small chance it doesn’t get released. 

Available
This status indicates that we’ve built a feature for this and it’s been released. Often it means the request was fulfilled, but it may also indicate that the feature already existed when the request was made.

Not a fit
Some requests just aren’t a good fit for Uberflip. It may be that they can’t be built with our current resources/technology, that it won’t benefit enough users, or that it doesn’t fit into our strategies or philosophies. Either way, we won't be moving forward with this request.

articles.name: Flipbot: What is Flipbot?
articles.title: Flipbot: What is Flipbot?
articles.body:
Flipbot is being retired

Flipbot will be going away on Nov. 1st, 2023. Check out Flipbot is being retired [Nov. 2023] for details. 

What is Flipbot?

Flipbot is an Uberflip app designed to help you track a prospect's content journey. When a prospect views a Sales Stream, Flipbot notifies the owner of that Sales Stream by sending them a direct message in Slack (from @flipbot), or by email (or both).

How Does Flipbot Work?

When a prospect visits your Sales Stream, you'll be notified (by Slack, Email, or both). This way you'll have the where, what, when and who information needed to follow up with prospect at the perfect time. Each notification is a bit different than the last, so you can easily follow their journey. 

Initial Notification

When an unknown prospect visits a Sales Stream (i.e. an anonymous visitor), Flipbot will send a simple message to that Stream’s owner. It looks like this in Slack:

And like this by email:

Flipbot also connects to your Marketing Automation Platform (MAP), so if the prospect is known (has a profile in your MAP), Flipbot will send a much more detailed message:

The information displayed in this message (i.e. email, title, etc.) is fully customizable. To help distinguish between different prospects, each individual prospect is randomly assigned one of 30 emoji faces (like the Koala in the screenshot above).

Subsequent Notifications

After the initial visit, every time a known or unknown prospect subsequently views an Item in a Stream, Flipbot will notify the Stream owner with a shorter, “partial” message:

  • Each of these messages also indicates the total number of Items viewed by the prospect to date. This number only counts unique views, so repeated views of the same Item are not included. Likewise, views of the Stream homepage are not included in this count, either.
  • If a prospect views an Item that they have previously viewed again, Flipbot will only send a new message notification if more than 30 minutes have passed since they last viewed the Item.

As a prospect visits more Items within a Stream, Flipbot modifies the “partial” messages with indicators to highlight particularly engaged prospects. When a prospect views their third Item, the message looks like this:

On the fourth Item, the message looks like this:

And after five or more Items, the message looks like this:

CTA Gating

Lastly, you can also optionally profile unknown prospects by configuring Flipbot to gate Sales Streams with a Form CTA. When an unknown prospect visits a gated Sales Stream and completes the Form CTA, Flipbot will send a corresponding notification to the Stream’s owner:

Want to try out Flipbot? Then head over to Flipbot: Install and configure Flipbot to learn how to get set up.

articles.name: Internal:  Bulk download account PDFs in Flipbook admin section
articles.title: Internal:  Bulk download account PDFs in Flipbook admin section
articles.body:
Objective

This code will automatically download the source PDFs for the Flipbooks visible in your browser window, within the Flipbooks admin section.

 

Prerequisite: Preparation within the Flipbooks admin section

  1. Go to Manage Flipbooks admin section
  2. Search for the client account
    • You will want to ensure that your search is returning the results of just that 1 specific client. Any outliers that you cannot filter out should be noted and removed from the downloaded PDFs.
  3. You might want to check that your browser download settings are not set to prompt for each download
    • Chrome example

 

Run custom JS snippet in browser's console window 

  1. Open DevTools > Console in browser
  2. Paste in the code provided below
  3. Update the counter (currently set at 10) to however many Flipbooks there are to download on the page (Admin allows a max of 100 items per page)
  4. Press ENTER
    • Note: You might get a prompt in your browser to verify if you want to download multiple items. Click "Yes"
  5. Repeat as needed on page 2+ if client has over 100 PDFs spanning multiple admin pages

 

Code snippet - bulk download Flipbooks

// set your counter to 0
var i = 0; 

// Download PDF button to variable
var downloadButtons = $('[data-original-title="Download PDF"]');

// create a loop function
function downloadPdfLoop() { 

// call a 3s setTimeout when the loop is called
setTimeout(function() { 

// Click download buttons on page
downloadButtons[i].click();

// increment the counter
i++; 

// if the counter < 10, call the loop function - SET THIS TO THE NUMBER OF PDFs AVAILABLE ON PAGE (MAX 100)
if (i < 10) { 

// .. again which will trigger another 
downloadPdfLoop(); 
} 

// setTimeout in milliseconds
}, 3000)
}

// start the loop
downloadPdfLoop();

articles.name: Sales Assist: Weekly performance email for admins
articles.title: Sales Assist: Weekly performance email for admins
articles.body:
Sales Assist admins receive an email summary of their team’s Sales Assist performance each week. This article outlines the details of this performance summary, and how to opt-in or out of the email. 

Before you begin 

  • Only Admins in Sales Assist have the option to receive the weekly performance email 
  • This email is sent every Monday
  • The week summarized in the email runs from Monday to Sunday

Details of your performance summary email

The weekly performance email contains five sections:

  1. Your engagement score
  2. Share performance totals
  3. Items with the highest engagement
  4. Team activity summary
  5. New updates you should know about

We’ll outline each section below.

Your engagement score

Your engagement score shows how well prospects have engaged with the DSRs your team shared that week. You can then compare this score to the Sales Assist weekly benchmark. 

How your engagement score is calculated: 

Engagement score = (avg_people/7) + (avg_items/11) + avg_time

This calculation is based on research that shows that on average, about 7 people in a given target account will engage with around 11 pieces of content before a purchasing decision is made. The average time that the account engages with the content simply acts as a score bonus: the more time, the better.

The benchmark is calculated the same way, but across all Sales Assist accounts (excluding outliers). With this, you can get a sense if your engagement is going well, or if it may need a boost. 

Below the engagement score you’ll see a short summary that includes: 

  • Number of new team members
  • Average Item views per share  
  • Average unique people (visitors) per share 
  • Average time content was viewed per share

Share performance totals

Share performance is a simple weekly overview of total:

  • Item views 
  • Unique visitors 
  • Time your visitors engaged with your content

Items with the highest engagement

This area shows the 3 Items that received the most engagement that week, based on the amount of time the Items were viewed.  

Team activity summary

This section summarizes what your team’s been up to over the past week, including:

  • DSRs created
  • Items created
  • Number of DSRs shared 

This is shown as a total number for each that week, as well as a graph showing the total combined actions that took place each day.

New updates you should know about

The final section is where you’ll find out about new features in Sales Assist, so you’re up to date on new tools you and your team can take advantage of. 

Opt-in or out of the weekly performance email 

If you’re a Sales Assist admin, you can decide to receive the engagement email (on by default) or turn these off for yourself. Here’s how: 

  1. In the Sales Assist app, click your name in the top right
  2. Click Edit Profile
  3. Under Preferences, check the box beside Weekly Digest Email to opt-in, or un-check the box to opt-out. Your selection will save automatically.

articles.name: [COPY] Sales Assist: User Guide for Sales Users
articles.title: [COPY] Sales Assist: User Guide for Sales Users
articles.body:
Learn how to use all of Sales Assist's features as a Sales User.

 

Before you begin

  • Just need the basics? Check out the Quick Start Guide.
  • To use Sales Assist, you'll need your Uberflip username and password. If you're not sure what they are, contact your Uberflip administrator for help.

 

About Sales Assist

What is Sales Assist?

Sales Assist is a sales engagement app for Uberflip, the platform your Marketing team uses to create and manage content. Sales Assist is specifically designed to help Sales teams to leverage that content for outreach, by making it easy to find and share content right within the tools you use every day.

You can use Sales Assist pretty much anywhere: in a browser on your desktop or phone, in Outlook (as an Add-in), or in sales tools like Salesloft or Outreach (using the Chrome extension).

With Sales Assist, you can:

  • Quickly find the perfect content for your outreach (and even create your own content for super-personalized outreach)
  • Build personalized content destinations in seconds
  • Easily share content with prospects by simply copying and pasting embeds into your emails
  • Get real-time notifications when a prospect visits content you've shared

What you'll learn

Follow this guide to learn how to use all of the tools available to you in Sales Assist, including:

  • How to access and log in to Sales Assist, including how to install the Chrome extension
  • How to navigate the app
  • How to find content using keywords, tags, and content type
  • How to share individual pieces of content
  • How to select multiple pieces of content to create and share custom destinations with your prospects, including:
    • Using templates to style your destinations
    • Protecting destinations with sensitive content by adding a passphrase
    • Managing your existing destinations to modify, share, and duplicate them to create new destinations
  • How to create your own content and templates
  • How to track how prospects are engaging with content you've shared

Note

Depending on how your Sales Assist admin has configured the app for your organization, some of the tools and functionality described in this guide may not be available to you.

 

Accessing Sales Assist

In this section, we'll look at your options for accessing Sales Assist, as well as how to log in to the app.

Options for accessing Sales Assist

Because Sales Assist is a web app, there are multiple ways to access it. Simply choose the option(s) that best fit your outreach workflow:

Browser (desktop and mobile) Chrome extension Outlook Add-in
  • Works with any browser, on any desktop or mobile device.
  • Choose this option if want to use Sales Assist on a phone or tablet, or if you prefer to use a larger version of the Sales Assist interface on your desktop.

To access Sales Assist in a browser:

  • Go to https://sa.uberflip.com/
  • Requires the Google Chrome browser.
  • Opens Sales Assist in a sidebar, next to your current Chrome tab.
  • Choose this option to use Sales Assist without having to leave the tab you're currently working in. This allows you to easily access Sales Assist while you're doing outreach by email (e.g. in Gmail), or using a web-based sales engagement tool (like Salesloft).

To access Sales Assist using the Chrome extension:

  • Go to the Chrome Web Store and download and install the Sales Assist extension.
  • Click on the Extensions (puzzle piece) button in Chrome, then click on Sales Assist by Uberflip:
  • Requires Outlook 2016 or newer, or Outlook Office 365 (Outlook on the web), or Outlook.com.
  • Opens Sales Assist in a sidebar within Outlook.
  • Choose this option to use Sales Assist without having to leave Outlook. This allows you to easily access Sales Assist while you're doing email outreach.

To access Sales Assist using the Outlook Add-in:

  • Install the Sales Assist Add-in for Outlook: see this article for detailed instructions on how to get and install the Add-in.

Logging in to Sales Assist

No matter which option you choose to access Sales Assist, the login process is the same:

  1. Click on Login with Uberflip.
  2. Enter your Uberflip username (email) and click Next.
  3. Enter your password and click Log In.
    • If your organization uses a Single Sign-On service (like Okta) to log in to Uberflip, click on the Log in with... button instead of entering your password, then sign in as normal. After you sign in, you'll be redirected back to Sales Assist.
  4. That's it! You're logged in to Sales Assist, and can begin using the app.

 

Navigating the app

In this section, we'll look at how to navigate the app.

Basic navigation

Sales Assist has three main sections: Search, My Streams, and My Shares. 

  • To navigate between these three sections, use the navigation menu at the top:

Note: If you are a Sales Assist administrator, you'll also see an Admin section. 

  • Click your name in the top right to open the user menu, where you can edit your profile, access Sales Assist help and documentation, or sign out of the app:
  • From anywhere in the app, you can also always hit the back button in the top left to go back to the last page you were on:

 

Section overview

Here's a quick overview of what you'll find in each section:

Search section My Streams section My Shares section

Click on in the navigation menu to open the Search section:

 

This section contains:

  1. The search tools, which allow you to find pieces of content ("Items"). You can search by keywords, tags, and content type, or just content within predefined content collections (Marketing Streams). You can also view the most shared Items in your organization, Items you've created yourself, or your favorited Items.
  2. The results panel, which lists all of the available content Items that match your search criteria. Here you can Add Items to your basket, see Items' preview or stats, or share Items directly. 
  3. The basket, which is where you "save" Items (even across different searches) to include in a personalized destination ("Stream").

Click on  in the navigation menu to open the My Streams section:

This section displays a list of your previously created Streams, and allows you to view and edit them, as well as share them and see activity on Streams you've shared.

Click on in the navigation menu to open the My Shares section:

This section shows you activity and stats on Items and Streams you've shared in the past 48 hours, so you can follow up at the right time.

 

Finding and sharing content

In this section, we'll look at how you can find content in Sales Assist, and how you can share an individual piece of content.

Finding content

Sales Assist gives you four ways to search the Items in your organization's content library: by keyword, by tags, by content type, and by collection (Marketing Stream).

By keyword By tags By type By collection

To find content Items that match one or more keywords:

  • On the All Items tab, enter the keywords you want into the search field:
  • Sales Assist will start searching as soon as you begin typing, and will display up to 50 results containing the entered keywords.
    • Sales Assist will also try to match partial keywords. For example, the keyword "market" would bring up content that contains not just the word itself, but also "markets" and "marketing".

Note

Keywords must be at least two characters long: any single character entered into the search field will be ignored.

To find content Items by their tags:

  • On the All Items tab, use the tag group dropdowns below the search field to view the available tags:
  • Click on a tag to select it. Sales Assist will immediately start searching for content tagged with the selected tag.
  • You can select one tag per available tag group.
  • You can select multiple tags (i.e. select a tag from two or more tag groups). If you select multiple tags, Sales Assist will search for content tagged with ALL of the selected tags.

Note

Tag groups are set up by Sales Assist administrators and are specific to each organization. As a result, the tag groups (and tags) you see in Sales Assist will likely be different from what is shown here.

To find content Items based on the type of content:

  • On the All Items tab, use the content type dropdown to the right of the search field to view available content types:
  • Click on the content type that you want. Sales Assist will immediately display the top 50 pieces of content of the selected type.

Note

You might see multiple instances of the same content type, as in the screenshot shown here. This happens when your organization has multiple sources of the same general type of content — in this case, videos from YouTube, Wistia, and Vidyard.

To find content Items based on the content collection (Marketing Stream) they are in:

  • Click on the Marketing Streams tab above the search field to view preset collections of content ("Streams") that your Sales Assist administrator has made available to you:
  • By default, the results panel will display highlighted Streams:
  • You can also use the search field to search through all available Streams.
  • Hover your mouse over the Stream, then click on Items on the right to view all available content in the Stream:

You can use each of the methods of finding content on the All Items tab either by itself, or in combination with the other methods. For example, you could search for content matching certain keywords, then further filter the results by tags and/or content type.

When you search for content on the All Items tab, the results will be sorted by Most Shared by default. Use the sorting dropdown in the top right of the search results area to sort the results in other ways, i.e. by Newest (publish date, most to least recent), or by Alphabetical (title, A to Z):

Other ways to find content

  • Search for the most shared Items: Click on the button when you first visit the Search section to view the 50 Items that other Sales Users in your organization have shared the most.
  • See just Items you have created: If you have created your own Items in Sales Assist, click on the button (to the right of the tag group buttons) to view them.

See an Items details, preview, and stats

You can see detailed info, a preview, and 90 day performance stats for any piece of content that appears in the search results. Here's how:

  1. In the Search section, hover your mouse over a piece of content that you want to preview.
  2. Click on the Details button:
  3. A model will open. Here you can select a tab to view the Items details, a preview, or its stats. 

Sharing a single Item or a Marketing Stream

You can share an individual piece of content (an Item), or a full premade collection of content (a Marketing Stream) with your prospects directly from the search results.

Sales Assist will generate a variety of embed options for content you choose to share, and you can simply paste the embed directly into an email:

To share a single piece of content or a Marketing Stream in Sales Assist, follow these instructions:

How to share a single Item

You can share individual pieces of content directly from the Search section in Sales Assist.

  1. In the Search section, click on the All Items tab.
  2. Find the content Item you want to share, then hover your mouse over it.
  3. Click on the Share button:

  4. Under Share Item with, enter the email address of the prospect you want to share this content with, then click the green checkmark button to the right.

    • Sales Assist will not send an email to this person — this is just to help you remember who this share was created for later on.
  5. When you share a single Item, it will be shown to the recipient in the context of your organization's resource center. If the same content appears in multiple different places (Streams), you can use the In Stream dropdown to choose which of the available contexts you want to use for this content:
     
    • Your shared Item will have a breadcrumb link to the Stream you select here, and your recipient will be able to navigate to and explore other content in the Stream.
  6. Next, choose the embed option you want to use. There are four options, with previews:
    1. Image and Text: Like a Facebook or Twitter link preview, with a large image and a text link.
    2. Tile Image: A compact image that functions as a clickable link to the content.
    3. Just Text: Just a text link, no image.
    4. Just the Link: No embed, just the underlying URL (including its share tracking code) that you can link to.
  7. Each option will appear just as shown in its preview. Click on Copy to Clipboard below the option you want to use.
  8. Finally, just paste the embed into an email (or elsewhere) to share it with your prospect (e.g. right-click anywhere in the email and click Paste, or just press Ctrl+V/Command+V).

Tip

When you share a link to an individual Item through Sales Assist, that link contains a unique share tracking code. Whenever someone views the Item using that link, you'll get a notification, and Sales Assist will also record this activity in the My Shares section.

How to share a Marketing Stream

You can share full Marketing Streams directly from the Search section in Sales Assist.

  1. In the Search section, click on the Marketing Streams tab.
  2. Find the Stream you want to share, then hover your mouse over it.
  3. Click on the Share button:
  4. Under Share Stream with, enter the email address of the prospect you want to share this content with, then click the green checkmark button to the right.

    • Sales Assist will not send an email to this person — this is just to help you remember who this share was created for later on.
  5. Next, choose the embed option you want to use. There are four options, with previews:

    1. Image and Text: Like a Facebook or Twitter link preview, with a large image and a text link.
    2. Tile Image: A compact image that functions as a clickable link to the content.
    3. Just Text: Just a text link, no image.
    4. Just the Link: No embed, just the underlying URL (including its share tracking code) that you can link to.
  6. Each option will appear just as shown in its preview. Click on Copy to Clipboard below the option you want to use.
  7. Finally, just paste the embed into an email (or elsewhere) to share it with your prospect (e.g. right-click anywhere in the email and click Paste, or just press Ctrl+V/Command+V).

 

Creating, customizing, and sharing Streams

In this section, we'll look at how you can create your own custom personalized Streams (destinations) for your prospects, as well as how to customize and share your Streams.

Creating a Stream

In addition to sharing individual pieces of content, Sales Assist also allows you to collect multiple pieces of content, and use them to create a self-contained microsite called a Stream.

Streams allow you to showcase a small collection of content that you've curated for your prospect. You can personalize a Stream with a custom headline and message, and use a template to make it look great:

To create Streams, follow these instructions:

How to create a Stream

You can create your own Streams to quickly build personalized destinations for your prospects.

Option 1: Start by selecting content

You can start creating a new Stream by first choosing the content that will be in it. This option is useful if you have some specific content in mind, or if you want to really personalize the Stream for your prospect.

  1. In the Search section, find some content you want to add to your Stream, then hover your mouse over it.
  2. Click on the Add button:
  3. This will add the content to your basket, which means it's selected to be included in your Stream. Repeat the process of adding content to your basket until you've added all the Items you want.
    • You can add up to 20 Items to a Stream in total.
    • Items that have been added to your basket will stay there, even if you change your search filters or perform a whole new search. Don't be afraid to keep searching to find the perfect content!
  4. When you're ready to proceed, click on the New Stream button.
  5. Fill out the Create a New Sales Stream form to personalize the destination for your prospect:

    • Heading (required): This is your destination's headline, shown in large text across the top.
    • Message (optional): Use this to enter a brief personalized message for your prospect. It's shown immediately below the heading.
    • Prospect (optional): Enter the email or just the domain (the part of the email after the @ symbol) of your prospect. Don't worry, nothing will be sent to them yet! Sales Assist just uses this information to find the prospect's company logo.
    • Template (optional): Select a premade template to style your destination (i.e. the banner, colors, etc.).
  6. Click on Create Stream.
  7. Your Stream will now be created, and the Manage Stream page will be shown. Here, you can customize your Stream (see below) before sharing it.

Option 2: Start without selecting content

You can also create a new Stream without first selecting content. This option is useful if your organization uses templates that "pre-fill" your Stream with selected content: in this case, just choose the appropriate template while creating the Stream, then either keep only the pre-filled content, or add/remove content as needed.

  1. In Sales Assist, click on the Streams button in the navigation menu.
  2. In the top right corner, click on the +New button.
  3. This will open the Create a New Sales Stream form. Simply complete this form as described in Option 1 above, then click on Create Stream.
  4. Your Stream will be created, and you'll be taken to the Manage Stream page. From here, you can customize your Stream (see below), for example by adding or removing Items.

Info

Once you've created at least one Stream, you'll also see an Existing button below the basket. Use this button to select an existing Stream to add the content in the basket to (rather than creating a new Stream):

Customizing a Stream

After creating a Stream, you can customize it in various ways. Sales Assist will show a live preview as you make changes so you can see how it looks. You can:

  • Change the heading, message, prospect, or template
  • Add a welcome video
  • Add Stream sections
  • Add a custom banner image
  • Add a passphrase, to protect Streams with sensitive contents
  • Add, remove, or change the order of Items in the Stream

To customize a Stream, use the Manage Stream page. This page is shown automatically whenever you create a Stream, but you can also reopen it manually at any time:

  1. In Sales Assist, click on the Streams button in the navigation menu.
  2. In the list of Streams, hover your mouse over the Stream you want to customize.
  3. Click on Edit:

  4. The Manage Stream page for the selected Stream will open.

To learn how to use the various customization options, follow the instructions below:

How to change a Stream's heading, message, or prospect logo

You can modify a Stream's heading, message, or prospect and logo at any time.

  • Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize. Then:

    1. To change the heading: Enter new text you want to use into the Heading field. The heading on the Stream will be updated immediately.
    2. To change the message: Enter the new text you want to use into the Message field (or remove the text). The message on the Stream will be updated immediately.
    3. To change the prospect logo: Click on the current logo to open the Set Stream Logo window. Search for the company name, then click on the option you want:

      The new logo will appear in the preview to the right, and will be updated on the Stream immediately.
      • You can also change the prospect by entering a new prospect email address (or domain) into the Prospect field. Doing this will not change the current prospect logo.
      • If you want to just remove the prospect logo altogether, click on remove logo below the preview.
How to add a welcome video

Add a welcome video that will auto-open when your prospect visits your Stream for the first time. 

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.
  2. Hover over the Stream you want to add a welcome video to and click Edit.
  3. Under the Details tab, enter the video URL into the Welcome Video URL field.
    Note: This can be hosted on any platform that supports embeddable video. 
How to add Stream section headings

Break your Stream into organized sections by adding section headings.

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.
  2. Hover over the Stream you want to add a heading to and click Edit.
  3. Click the Items tab.
  4. Click the meatball (three dot) menu icon, then click Add a Section Heading.
    A new section heading will appear at the top of the Items list.
  5. Hover over the section heading Item and click Edit.
  6. In the modal that appears, enter a heading name, then click Update.
  7. Drag and drop your new section heading to where you'd like it in your Stream.
  8. Drag and drop your other items into place if needed. 
How to add a calendar booking CTA

Add a calendar booking CTA to your Stream or Items, so your Stream viewers can instantly book a meeting with you. 

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.
  2. Hover over the Stream you want to add a heading to and click Edit.
  3. Select the Items tab.
  4. Click the Add Calendar button.
    Note: If the button is grayed out, there is already a Calendar Item in your Stream. Find it, hover over it, and click Configure to continue.
  5. In the modal that opens, enter the URL of your calendar, then click Confirm.
    Note: Sales Assist can integrate with most embeddable calendar booking services.  
  6. Enter a tagline, button label, and choose to display the CTA at Item level, Stream level, or both.
  7. Drag and drop your calendar CTA where you'd like it displayed among your Items.
How to change a Stream's template

The template you have applied to a Stream determines its appearance. Even after you have created a Stream, you can still change the template used by the Stream at any time.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on More Settings.
  3. Use the Template dropdown to select a new template:
  4. The new template will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream.
How to add a custom banner image to a Stream

When you choose a template for your Stream, it will (typically) include a preset banner image. If you want, you can replace the template-default banner image with one of your choice.

Info

To do this, you'll need the URL where the new banner image is hosted. The URL must end with the image file extension (e.g. .jpg, .png, etc.) to work.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on More Settings.
  3. Enter the URL of the banner image you want to use instead into the Custom Banner Image field:
  4. The new banner will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream.

Note

If you change the template of this Stream after setting a custom banner, the custom banner will be removed and replaced with the banner specified in the template.

How to add a passphrase to a Stream

If you need to ensure that only a specific audience can view the Stream, you can protect it by adding a passphrase: anyone who visits the link must enter the correct passphrase before they can view the content in the Stream.

Tip

This option is especially useful for Streams that include sensitive content, such as pricing information.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on More Settings.
  3. Enter the passphrase you want to use into the Passphrase Protect field:
    • The passphrase must be between 6 and 40 characters in length, and must contain at least one letter and one number.
  4. If the passphrase meets the requirements, you'll see a green checkmark beside the Passphrase Protect field, and the passphrase will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream:
  5. Lastly, don't forget to tell your prospect what the passphrase is!
How to add, remove, or change the order of Items in a Stream

Add an Item

You can add Items to an existing Stream.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream to which you want to add Items.
  2. Select the Items tab.
  3. Click on Add Items

  4. Add Items to your basket as usual.
  5. Below the basket, click on Current Stream

  6. The new Items will be added to the Stream immediately.

Tip

You can also add Items to an existing Stream from the Search section. Just scroll down to the basket, then click on Existing and choose the Stream you want to add the Items in the basket to:

(Note that this list will display the Streams you've used most recently. If the Stream you want doesn't appear in this list, use the search field to find it.)

Remove an Item

You can also remove Items from an existing Stream.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream from which you want to remove Items.
  2. Select the Items tab.
  3. In the basket, hover your mouse over the Item and click on Remove:
  4. The Item will removed from the Stream immediately. 

Change the order of Items in a Stream

The order of content Items in your Stream's basket also determines the order in which content appears in the Stream. For example, this basket:

Would result in a Stream that looks like this:

You can change the order of Items in a Stream by simply dragging-and-dropping them in the basket:

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to customize.
  2. Click on the Items tab.
  3. Click-and-hold on any Item you want to move to a different place in the order, then drag it to the desired position:
  4. The new Item order will be applied immediately. To see the change, click on Preview Stream.

Tip

This works anywhere the basket is shown, so you can even determine the order of Items in your Stream while still filling the basket.

Sharing a Stream

When your Stream is ready, you can easily share it with your prospect.

Just like sharing a single Item, sharing a Stream creates a variety of embed options. All you need to do is choose which embed option you want, then simply paste into an email:

As with all content you share through Sales Assist, embed links for Streams contain a unique share tracking code that allow the app to keep track and notify you when a prospect engages with your shared content.

To share a Stream, follow these instructions:

How to share a Stream

You can share any new or existing Stream that you've created in Sales Assist.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to share.
  2. Click on the Share button:
  3. Choose the embed option you want to use. There are four options, with previews:
    1. Image and Text: Like a Facebook or Twitter link preview, with a large image and a text link.
    2. Tile Image: A compact image that functions as a clickable link to the content.
    3. Just Text: Just a text link, no image.
    4. Just the Link: No embed, just the underlying URL (including its share tracking code) that you can link to.
  4. Each option will appear just as shown in its preview. Click on Copy to Clipboard below the option you want to use.
  5. Finally, just paste the embed into an email (or elsewhere) to share it with your prospect (e.g. right-click anywhere in the email and click Paste, or just press Ctrl+V/Command+V).

Info

The image used for the embed will be taken from the first Item in the Stream. If you want to use a different image, just change the order of Items in the Stream.

Tip

You can also share an existing Stream directly from the My Streams section. Just hover your mouse over the Stream, then click on Share:

 

Managing your Streams

In this section, we'll look at how to manage the Streams you have created.

Managing Streams

You can manage your own Streams in various ways. You can:

  • Duplicate a Stream to create a new Stream from an existing Stream
  • Archive Streams that are no longer needed
  • Use advanced edit options to make changes to a Stream beyond what is available within Sales Assist
  • Transfer a Stream to a teammate

To manage your Streams, go to the My Streams section:

  1. Click on the Streams button in the navigation menu.
  2. You will see a list of Streams you have created. Hover your mouse over the Stream you want to manage.
  3. Click on the Edit button:
  4. The Manage Stream page will open for the selected Stream.

Tip

From the My Streams section, you can also directly preview, share, or view engagement activity for each of your Streams.

To duplicate, archive, or access advanced edit options for a Stream, follow these instructions:

How to duplicate a Stream

You can copy any existing Stream to create a new Stream. This is useful if you have an existing Stream that you want to reuse for a different prospect.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to duplicate.
  2. In the top right, click on the Duplicate Stream button:
  3. In the Duplicate This Stream window, enter a heading, message, and prospect for the new Stream:
  4. Click on Create Stream.
  5. Your new Stream will immediately be created. The new Stream will have the new heading, message, and prospect and logo you just set, but will otherwise be an exact duplicate of the existing Stream (the same template, content, customizations, etc.). From here, you can either modify the Stream further, or just share it right away.
How to archive a Stream

When you no longer need a Stream, you can archive it. This will effectively delete the Stream, removing it from your list of Streams in Sales Assist.

Important

When you archive a Stream, a Sales Assist admin can still recover it for you if needed. However, any share data associated with the Stream will be lost forever as soon as you archive it.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to archive.
  2. In the top right, click on the Archive Stream button:
  3. After confirming that you want to archive the Stream, it will be removed from your list of Streams immediately (and associated share data will be removed from the My Shares section).
How to access advanced edit options for a Stream

If you want to customize your Stream beyond what's possible with the options available in Sales Assist, you can access advanced edit options in the Uberflip backend.

  1. Open the Manage Stream page for the Stream you want to archive.
  2. In the top right, click on the Advanced Edit in Uberflip button:
  3. The Stream will open in the Uberflip backend in a new tab. Here, you can customize the Stream's settings as needed: for more details, see this article.
How to transfer a Stream to a teammate

Transfer a Stream you've created to a teammate so they can continue the work.

Note: Transferring a Stream will remove it from your Streams list. You'll no longer have access to this Stream unless it's transferred back to you.

  1. Go to the Streams page in Sales Assist.  
  2. Click the meatball (three dot) icon, then click Transfer to Teammate.
  3. Search for your teammate, and click their name once you find them. 
  4. Click Confirm.

The Stream will now appear in your teammates Streams list in Sales Assist. 

 

Creating your own content and templates

In this section, we'll look at how you can create your own content Items and templates in Sales Assist.

Creating and managing your own Items

You can create your own content Items directly within Sales Assist. This is useful for bringing documents you've created outside of Uberflip into Sales Assist, such as slide decks, spreadsheets, etc., or other one-off documents you've created especially for certain prospects. Unlike Items from your organization's content library, Items you have created are available only to you.

Tip

This feature is great for bringing in pricing sheets — especially in combination with the passphrase protect feature.

Depending on the content you're working with, you have two options when creating your own Items: you can either embed (iframe) the content, or display a link to open the content in a new tab.

Embed the content

If the content you want to share is allowed to be embedded, you can simply enter the URL where the content is hosted (e.g. a Google Docs URL), and Sales Assist will display that content within the Item:

You can embed almost any content that is hosted on the web and which is allowed to be embedded (not all content can be displayed in an iframe):

  • URLs that end with a supported Office Document filetype extension (.doc/.docx/.ppt/.pptx/.xls/.xlsx) will be displayed using the Office Web Viewer
  • URLs ending with .pdf will be displayed using the Google PDF Viewer
  • URLs to Google Docs file (including Docs, Sheets, Slides, etc.) will be displayed using the relevant Google viewer for that file type

Note

Due to Dropbox restrictions, Sales Assist can't display content hosted on Dropbox by default. If you want to bring in content from Dropbox, your Sales Assist admin must complete additional setup steps.

Display a Link

Some content can't be embedded, such as Zoom or Gong recordings. In these cases you have the option of displaying a placeholder within your Item instead, with a button that opens the content in a new tab:

Using this option allows you to "embed" any kind of content in your Items, even if that content does not allow embedding.

To create and manage your own Items, follow these instructions:

How to create an Item

You can create your own Items, which you can share directly or add to Streams like any other Item in Sales Assist.

  1. Click on Search in the navigation menu.
  2. Below the search box, click on the My Items button:
  3. Click on the Create an Item button.
  4. In the Create and Insert Your Own Item window, paste the URL of your content into the Embed URL field:

    • Sales Assist will attempt to get an appropriate title, description, and thumbnail image for your content from the metadata of the URL you provided. If it can find these details, it will automatically prefill the relevant fields for you.
  5. If the content can't be embedded (e.g. because the website prevents embedding of their content), check the box beside Display Link instead of iFrame:
  6. If needed, complete (or edit) the Title and Description fields.
  7. If you want to change the thumbnail image (or set one, if none was found) for your Item, either:
    • Enter the URL of the image you want to use (the URL must end in an image extension, like .jpg, .png, etc.), or
    • Click on an image in the image library created by your Sales Assist admin, to use it for your Item:
  8. Optionally, you can also add some additional text that will be displayed below the embedded content. To do so, click on Add Context for Prospect, then type your text into the field that appears.
  9. When you're ready, click on the Create button to create your new Item.
  10. You'll be returned to the My Items view in the Search section, where you'll see your new Item listed:
  11. From here, you can preview your new Item, add it to a Stream, or share it directly — just like any other content Item.
How to edit or delete your Items

You can modify or delete Items you have created at any time.

  1. Click on Search in the navigation menu.
  2. Below the search field, click on My Items.
  3. Find the Item you want to edit or delete in the list and hover your mouse over it.
  4. Click on the Edit button:
  5. The Edit Your Item window will open:

    1. To edit the Item: Use the fields to make any changes, then click on the Edit Item button to save your changes.
    2. To delete the Item: Click on the delete (trash) button in the lower left corner. After confirming that you want to continue, your Item will be deleted immediately (removing it from any Streams you had placed it in).

Creating your own templates

In addition to the system templates that are created by your Sales Assist admins, you can also create personal templates to style your Streams. Unlike system templates, personal templates are available only to you.

To create and manage personal templates, follow these instructions:

How to create and customize a personal template

You can create your own personal templates, which you can use just like system templates in Sales Assist.

  1. Click on Search.
  2. Add Items that you want to be part of the template to your basket, then click on the New Stream button.
    • The Item(s) you add to your basket in this step will be part of the template, i.e. they will be added to the Stream anytime you select this template. If you prefer to create a template with no Items included, simply choose any random Item for this step, then remove it later.
  3. In the Create a New Sales Stream form, skip directly to the template dropdown and choose the option + Create New:
  4. The Create a New Sales Stream form will change. Enter a name for your template, then click on the Create New Template button:
  5. The Manage Template page will open. Here, you can customize your template in the same way you would customize a Stream. On templates specifically, you can:
    • Set the name and description of your template (these are only visible to you, and are not part of any Streams you create from this template)
    • Add a custom banner image which will appear on all Streams created from this template
    • Add a passphrase which will be applied to all Streams created from this template
    • Use the advanced edit options by clicking on the Advanced Edit Template in Uberflip button in the top right to further customize the template:
  6. At this stage you can also remove items from the template that you added in Step 2 (if you want a template with no Items):
  7. Any changes you make on this page will be saved automatically, so you can simply exit this page at any time (by navigating to another part of the app).
  8. Once created, your templates will appear as an option when creating or editing a Stream:
How to edit or delete a personal template

You can modify or delete your personal templates at any time.

  1. Click on Streams in the navigation menu.
  2. The My Streams section will list your personal templates alongside your Streams, marked with a Template badge:
  3. Hover your mouse over the template you want to manage, then click on the Edit button:
  4. The Manage Template window will open:

    1. To edit the template: Use the fields to make any changes, or click on the Advanced Edit button in the top right for additional options. Any changes you make are saved automatically.
    2. To add Items: Click on Add more, add the Items to your basket, then click on Existing and choose the template from the list:
    3. To remove Items: Hover your mouse on the Item in the basket, then click on Remove.
    4. To delete the template: Click on the delete (trash) button in the lower left corner. After confirming that you want to continue, your Item will be deleted immediately (removing it from any Streams you had placed it in).

Tracking share engagement

In this section, we'll look at how you can keep track of how prospects are engaging with content you've shared through Sales Assist.

Tracking engagement in real-time with notifications

Sales Assist is able to notify you in real-time whenever there is activity on a link you've shared through the app. And because links created by Sales Assist are unique to specific shares, Sales Assist can attribute activity to specific shares (and, by extension, to the prospect associated with a share). As a result, you'll know exactly when your prospects are engaging with the content you've shared, and can follow up at just the right time.

Here's how it works:

  • When you share a link to content, Sales Assist starts monitoring that content for activity
  • While the app is open, Sales Assist checks every two minutes if there has been new activity on your shares
  • If there is new activity, and that activity came from a link that's tied to a particular share, Sales Assist will send you a notification:
  • You can then simply click on the notification to see more details

Sales Assist can send you two types of notifications:

  • If you're currently working in the app, it will send you an in-app notification.
  • If the app is open, but not on the active tab, it will send you a desktop notification.

If the app is not open, you won't get a notification — but you can still catch up on historical engagement records in the app when you log in again later.

Viewing share engagement and stats

Your prospects won't always be checking out your shares while you have Sales Assist open. For activity that took place while you were logged off, or for notifications you missed, you can use the My Shares section in Sales Assist to catch up.

How to view engagement stats
  1. To access the My Shares section, click on Shares in the navigation menu:
  2. Here, in the Stats tab, you'll see your Stream's activity data from the last 90 days. This includes Items views, how many people viewed your Stream, and for how long it was viewed. You'll also see performance over time and your top performing Items.
How to view historical share engagement

You can visit the My Shares section at any time to review past engagement activity on your shares.

  1. To access the My Shares section, click on Shares in the navigation menu:
  2. Select the Events Log tab
  3. The Event Log section displays specific activity details, broken down by individual shares (prospect emails), for any of your shares that had activity in the past 90 days. By default, it will show only share activity that happened in the last 48 hours:
  4. Use the filter dropdown to view older share activity for other shares (which had at least some share activity in the past 90 days). By default, the filter dropdown lists just shares with recent activity. You can also use the search field in the filter dropdown to find shares that do not appear in this list:
  5. You can also view historical share engagement for any Stream you've created directly from the My Streams section. To do so, just click on Streams, then hover your mouse over the Stream and click on the Activity button:

Info

Although Sales Assist attributes activity to specific prospects, keep in mind that this is an assumption: since the activity came from a link that's unique to your prospect, it's most likely that this is the person who visited the link — but Sales Assist has no way of knowing for certain.

 

What's next?

Now that you're a Sales Assist power user, go check out our FAQ, which has answers to common questions you might have as you use Sales Assist:

  • Sales Assist: Frequently Asked Questions

articles.name: Internal: Draft and approve internal help articles
articles.title: Internal: Draft and approve internal help articles
articles.body:
Got knowledge you think will be useful to your team or others at Uberflip? Document it in our internal help center using the steps outlined below. 

Looking to have a public facing article drafted? Request a new public article using the steps here. 

Before you begin

  • If you haven’t already, familiarize yourself with the Help Center style basics to ensure your article is consistent with others

Draft an article

  1. In a new or existing Zendesk ticket, open the Knowledge Capture app
    (Click the magnifying glass icon below the reply field)
  2. Click the Create Knowledge (+) button in the Knowledge Capture app
  3. Select a template

  4. Add a title (starting with "Internal:") and content to the article, following the structure of the template
    Note: Every article is different. While the template is a great outline to start with, change the article structure as needed to suit your article.
  5. In the right side panel, select your article settings and categories. For internal articles, it will be: 
    1. Managed By: Admins
    2. Visible to: Internal
    3. Publish in section: Internal Documentation > Internal Articles For Review
    4. Author: You
    5. Labels: [Labels are like tags on an article. If you think Uberflippers may search using keywords not used in your article, add those words as labels.]
  6. Click Save
    Note: The article created is a duplicate of the template; it does not overwrite the template.
  7. Inform your team lead that there is a new article waiting for review. Include the article title. 

Your article is now saved as a draft in the Internal Articles For Review section of the internal Help Center. 

Approve an article (Team Leads) 

Has a team member let you know they've written a new article? Here's how to review and publish it.  

  1. Log into the Zendesk Guide admin panel 
  2. Search for the article that's been created
  3. Review the article, considering: 
    • Writing and grammar
    • Style guide
    • Template compliance (within reason)
    • Duplicate or similar articles
    • Accuracy
  4. Make edits or, in a third party tool like Slack or Google Docs, ask the author to make needed adjustments
    Note: See how an article will look once published by clicking Preview in Help Center in the right side panel (below Save button). 
  5. Once adjustments are made and the article is ready to be published, click the drop down next to the Save button in the top left. 
  6. Click Publish

The article is now live in the internal Help Center!

articles.name: Internal: Help Center style basics
articles.title: Internal: Help Center style basics
articles.body:
Writing for the Uberflip Help Center? Uberflip has company wide content guidelines, but this guide quickly outlines some basic conventions that apply directly to Uberflip help articles. 

Grammar quick tips

  • Use American english (e.g. "color" over colour)
  • Prefer contractions (e.g. "you’ll" over "you will")
  • Avoid unnecessarily complex words (ex. "chat" over "confabulate")
  • Prefer active voice 
  • Use the least amount of words/sentences needed to convey your message 

Titles and headings 

Title and headings at Uberflip use sentence case, meaning only the first letter and proper nouns are capitalized. 

Example:
Embed a YouTube video into a blog post

Unless necessary, avoid using ‘How to’ and gerunds (-ing) in titles and headings.

Example:
Incorrect: Embedding a YouTube video into a blog post
Incorrect: How to embed a YouTube video into a blog post
Correct: Embed a YouTube video into a blog post

Titles

When creating an article in Zendesk, there will be a dedicated field for your title. 

Headings 

Help articles use headings H2-H4 headings as needed (you’re not likely to need an H1 heading in a help article). 

H2 

  • Used for article sections
  • Any H2 heading in an article will appear in the table of contents when the article is published

H3 & H4

  • Smaller than H2 respectively
  • Will not appear in the table of contents
  • Use these headings for subsections of an H2 article section, or when a section isn’t in need of its own section in the table of contents. 

Add navigational elements 

Want to add elements that help organize and prioritize information in your article? In Zendesk, either natively or with a small bit of custom code, you can add:

  • Callout Blocks
  • Lists
  • Description Lists
  • Code Blocks
  • Tables
  • Tabs
  • Accordions
  • Links

Check out Internal Reference: Custom Zendesk Formatting Components for a full guide on adding these to your article.

More Uberflip writing resources

Want to take your knowledge of Uberflip's writing style further? Check out these sections of the Uberflip Content Guidelines:

  • Voice and tone
  • Grammar and mechanics
  • Frequently used words

articles.name: Internal: Request a public article or article update
articles.title: Internal: Request a public article or article update
articles.body:
Found a knowledge gap in Uberflip’s Help Center? Let’s document it for our users!

Before you begin

Article requests should fit within the scope of the Uberflip Help Center. A good help article topic will: 

  • be useful to multiple users (edge-cases should not be publicly documented)
  • not quickly become obsolete through upcoming product changes
  • Pertain directly to app.uberflip.com, an Uberflip app, or the integration process between Uberflip and third-party software
    Note: We do not document third-party software issues (i.e. issues in Marketo)  
  • not already be documented in the Help Center (be sure to check before making a request)

Note: Only articles and updates that fit the scope of the Uberflip Help Center will be added to the backlog. 

 

Request a new public article 

  1. Go to the #product-writing Slack channel
  2. Hover at the top of the channel and click Workflows

  3. Click Request Public Help Doc 
  4. Fill out the form that appears as accurately as you can (the more detail the better).
    To do so, you'll need to outline:
    • The issue users are experiencing
    • An estimate of how many users are experiencing the issue
    • The solution to the issue 
    • Supporting documentation (i.e. Slack URL, internal docs, Jira tickets, etc.)[optional] 
  5. Click Submit

Your request will appear in the #product-writing channel, and will be reviewed by the Product Technical Writer as soon as possible.

Note

When articles are written is based on the article’s priority and the Technical Writer’s bandwidth. 

 

Request an article update

If you’ve found that an article has out of date steps, or information that’s no longer correct, let us know! 

Note

Small updates, like typos or broken hyperlinks, can be raised as a simple message in the #product-writing Slack channel. The steps below are for content changes only.

  1. Go to the #product-writing Slack channel
  2. Hover at the top of the channel and click Workflows
  3. Click Request Article Update  
  4. Fill out the form that appears as accurately as you can (the more detail the better).
    To do so, you'll need to outline :
    • The article that needs updating
    • The section(s) in the article that needs updating
    • The new info that replaces the outdated info
  5. Click Submit

Your request will appear in the #product-writing channel, and will be reviewed by the Product Technical Writer as soon as possible.

 

Boost a request 🙌

Has a teammate made a request that you think is top-notch and sooooo needed? Add an emoji to show your support! 🔥 ➕

Have tips, suggestions, or supporting material to add to what your teammate included? Thread those on the request message. 

Crowdsourced additions like these help to boost the article's usefulness and priority. 💪

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Export and special bulk actions
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Export and special bulk actions
articles.body:
Learn how to use bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher that are set up without a job template: the Export and special actions.

 

Before you begin

  • This article provides instructions on how how to use bulk action functionality in Bulk Task Smasher that does not require the use of a job template, i.e. the Export and special bulk actions. If you're looking for more general information about using Bulk Task Smasher, including what the app does and how to install it, please see the article Bulk Task Smasher: User Guide.
  • To follow the instructions in this article, you must either:
    • Be a member of the Account Administrators user group in the Uberflip account where you are using Bulk Task Smasher, or
    • Have the appropriate permissions to use any or all of the bulk actions described in this article.

 

About the Export and special bulk actions

Some bulk actions available in Bulk Task Smasher do not require a job template to be set up. This includes:

  • All Export bulk actions
  • All partially-automated special bulk actions, e.g. Delete Items Older Than Date or Hide/Show Items Older Than Date
  • All fully-automated special bulk actions, e.g Delete All Tags or Delete All Unused Tags

When you select these bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher, they do not provide the option to download or upload a job template: instead, you configure these bulk actions entirely within the Bulk Task Smasher app.

Note

Most bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher need a job template to be set up: bulk actions that are set up using a job template follow a different setup process, which is outlined in the article Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions.

 

Set up and run an Export bulk action

Use this process to set up an Export bulk action for any of the resource types that Bulk Task Smasher works with. This will generate an export file, a spreadsheet file containing the data exported from your Uberflip account.

Tip

Unlike the other bulk action types that Bulk Task Smasher support, Export bulk actions do not make any changes to your Uberflip account, and as a result are generally safe to use.

  1. Open Bulk Task Smasher and go to the Run Jobs section of the app.
  2. Use the Resource dropdown menu to choose the type of Uberflip resource you'd like to work with:
  3. Next, use the Action dropdown to choose the Export bulk action for the selected resource:
  4. If any are available, you'll now see options for including additional data with the selected type of export. Apply any options you want using the checkboxes provided (or leave them all unchecked):
  5. Click on the Export button to begin the export. Bulk Task Smasher will begin processing your export and then download the export file once it's ready.

Note

  • Depending on the amount of data in your Uberflip account, and the selections you made when setting up the export, this process may take some time.
  • While the export is being processed and downloaded, do not refresh the page or navigate to a different page, as this will cancel the export.
  • Unlike other types of bulk actions, Export bulk actions are processed immediately, and are not recorded in the jobs table.

 

Set up and run an Export Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action

The Flipbooks/PDFs resource type in Bulk Task Smasher is a special case, because bulk actions involving this resource must use the Uberflip Legacy API. The Legacy API requires a separate login, and does not support the same types of actions as the current Uberflip REST API (which is used by all other Uberflip resources).

As a result, the Flipbooks/PDFs resource only supports Create and Export actions, and the procedure for setting up the Export Flipbooks/PDFs action differs slightly from the other Export actions.

Important

Only the Primary User of an Uberflip account can use the Legacy API, so these bulk actions are only available when you are logged in as the Primary User.

Use this process to set up an Export Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action:

  1. To set up an Export Flipbooks/PDFs bulk action, open Bulk Task Smasher and go to the Run Jobs section.
  2. Use the Resources dropdown to select "Flipbooks/PDFs".
  3. Although Bulk Task Smasher can obtain your Uberflip REST API credentials automatically, it is not able to do so for your Legacy API credentials. As a result, you'll need to enter your Legacy API credentials to proceed. If you do not know your Legacy API credentials, click on the link provided to view them (and generate them if needed):
  4. After entering your Legacy API credentials, click on Validate and Save Credentials.
    • The credentials you have entered will be saved for the rest of your session, so you won't need to enter them again if you run multiple Flipbooks/PDFs bulk actions.
  5. Now, use the Actions dropdown to select Export Flipbooks/PDFs.
  6. You'll now have the option to include additional data with the export. Check the box to include that additional data, or leave it empty to exclude it:
  7. Click on the Export PDFs button to begin the export. Bulk Task Smasher will begin processing your export and then download the export file once it's ready.

Set up and run a special bulk action

Warning

Always use this tool with caution.

Bulk Task Smasher can rapidly make extensive changes to your Uberflip account. If you make a mistake, any unwanted changes may be difficult or even impossible to reverse.

To reduce the chances of accidentally making unwanted changes to your Uberflip account, we strongly recommend that you read and use our best practices for using Bulk Task Smasher.

Before you run any bulk action in Bulk Task Smasher, always ensure that you understand exactly what will happen as a result.

Use this process to set up special bulk actions, which are partially- and fully-automated bulk actions that are set up entirely within Bulk Task Smasher, and therefore do not require job template.

  1. Open Bulk Task Smasher and go to the Run Jobs section of the app.
  2. Use the Resource dropdown menu to choose the type of Uberflip resource you'd like to work with:
  3. Next, use the Action dropdown to choose a special bulk action for the selected resource. These are generally listed under the Misc. heading.
  4. You'll now see controls that are specific to special bulk action you selected, for example:
  5. Use the controls to configure the selected bulk action. Then, click on the "Find" button to proceed.
    • Clicking this button will only analyze your account for resources matching your setting. The bulk action will NOT be performed yet.
  6. You will now see a preview of resources that would be affected by running this bulk action. If needed, you can make further changes using the controls provided, and Bulk Task Smasher will update the preview immediately:
  7. For some special bulk actions, additional controls will appear. If applicable, use these controls to further configure the special bulk action:
  8. Once the special bulk action is fully configured and ready to be submitted, the Submit Job button will activate. When you have verified that the special bulk action has been configured correctly, click on Submit Job:
  9. You will see a confirmation window that summarizes the effect of submitting this job, and warns you that once you submit the job, you will NOT be able to stop or undo it:
  10. If you would like to receive an email notification when the job finishes, you can optionally enter an email address into the Recipient Email Address field. Leave this field blank if you do not wish to receive an email (you can check job status at any time from within Bulk Task Smasher).
  11. When you are absolutely sure that you understand what will be changed in your account as a result of running this job, type the word CONFIRM into the field provided, then click on the Confirm Job button to finish submitting the job:
  12. Your job will be submitted to the Bulk Task Smasher queue for processing, and after a moment, you should see a confirmation message that your job has been successfully submitted.
    • The confirmation message contains the job's unique job ID. You can use this ID to quickly find this job while viewing your account's record of submitted jobs:

After you have submitted a job, Bulk Task Smasher will process it. Depending on the size of the job, this may take some time. At any time after submitting a job, you can view the jobs table to check on its status.

articles.name: Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions
articles.title: Bulk Task Smasher: Set up and run Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions
articles.body:
Learn how to use bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher that are set up using a job template: the Create, Update, and Delete actions.

 

Before you begin

  • This article provides instructions on how how to use the Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions within Bulk Task Smasher. If you're looking for more general information about using Bulk Task Smasher, including what the app does and how to install it, please see the article Bulk Task Smasher: User Guide.
  • To follow the instructions in this article, you must either:
    • Be a member of the Account Administrators user group in the Uberflip account where you are using Bulk Task Smasher, or
    • Have the appropriate permissions to use any or all of the bulk actions described in this article.

 

About the Create, Update, and Delete bulk actions

The majority of available bulk actions in Bulk Task Smasher are set up using a job template, which is a specially formatted spreadsheet file. This includes:

  • All Create bulk actions
  • All Update bulk actions
  • All Delete/Remove bulk actions, except special bulk actions.

The basic procedure for setting up and running a bulk action that uses a job template is:
